CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 8, 1941, pg. 18, reads: "Last Tuesday afternoon, Harry Bobo, promising young heavyweight of Pittsburgh had the privilege of taking a few lessons from one of the greatest defensive boxers of all time, Jack Johnson. Preparing for his important fight with 'Wild Bill' Boyd at the Garden here Monday night, Bobo learned some tricks he will try on his opponent Monday....Top, left: Johnson, former heavyweight champion shows Harry how to evade a long left jab... - Harris photos."
TitMainTitle: Heavyweight boxing champion Jack Johnson wearing suit, coaching heavyweight boxer Harry Bobo with left arm extended, in ring, Centre Avenue YMCA
CatSubject_tab: Johnson, Jack, 1878-1946.Bobo, Harry.Young Men's Christian Association (Pittsburgh, Pa.)Boxers--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Boxing--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Gymnasiums--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.
